0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Allergic rhinitis: (Omnaris(R)) 2 sprays (50 mcg/spray) in each nostril once daily; MAX total daily dose of 2 sprays in each nostril (200 mcg/day)
  • Allergic rhinitis: (Zetonna(TM)) 1 actuation (37 mcg/actuation) in each nostril once daily; MAX total daily dose of 1 actuation in each nostril (74 mcg/day)
  • Asthma: (Alvesco(R)) previous bronchodilators use, initial, 80 mcg ORAL INHALATION twice daily; MAX, 160 mcg INHALATION twice daily
  • Asthma: (Alvesco(R)) previous inhaled corticosteroid use, 80 mcg ORAL INHALATION twice daily; MAX, 320 mcg twice daily
  • Asthma: (Alvesco(R)) previous oral corticosteroid use, 320 mcg ORAL INHALATION twice daily; MAX, 320 mcg ORAL INHALATION twice daily; with gradual reduction of oral corticosteroid (prednisone no faster than 2.5 mg/day on a weekly basis) after at least 1 week of ciclesonide therapy

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• (Omnaris(R)) effectiveness for the treatment of perennial rhinitis in children under 12 years of age has not been established and effectiveness for the treatment of seasonal rhinitis in children under 6 years of age has not been established; (Zetonna(TM)) safety and efficacy in children under 12 years of age have not been established
  • Allergic rhinitis: (Omnaris(R), 6 years and older; seasonal allergic rhinitis) 2 sprays (50 mcg/spray) in each nostril once daily; max total daily dose of 2 sprays in each nostril (200 mcg/day)
  • Allergic rhinitis: (Omnaris(R), 12 years and older; perennial allergic rhinitis) initial, 2 sprays (50 mcg/spray) in each nostril once daily; max total daily dose of 2 sprays in each nostril (200 mcg/day)
  • Allergic rhinitis: (Zetonna(TM), 12 years and older; seasonal or perennial allergic rhinitis) 1 actuation (37 mcg/actuation) in each nostril once daily; MAX total daily dose of 1 actuation in each nostril (74 mcg/day)
  • Asthma: (Alvesco(R)) 12 years and older, previous bronchodilators use, 80 mcg ORAL INHALATION twice daily; MAX, 160 mcg INHALATION twice daily
  • Asthma: (Alvesco(R)) 12 years and older, previous inhaled corticosteroid use, initial, 80 mcg ORAL INHALATION twice daily; MAX, 320 mcg twice daily
  • Asthma: (Alvesco(R)) 12 years and older, previous oral corticosteroid use, initial, 320 mcg ORAL INHALATION twice daily; MAX, 320 mcg ORAL INHALATION twice daily; with gradual reduction of oral corticosteroid (prednisone no faster than 2.5 mg/day on a weekly basis) after at least 1 week of ciclesonide therapy

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity to ciclesonide or any other component of the product
  • primary treatment of status asthmaticus or other acute episodes of asthma requiring intensive intervention (oral inhalation)

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• adrenal insufficiency and hypercorticism, sometimes severe, has been reported; increased risk when switching from systemic therapy or with higher doses and prolonged duration of use; carefully observe patients during periods of stress for inadequate adrenal response; supplemental oral corticosteroids may be necessary
  • angioedema with involvement of the lips, tongue and pharynx has been reported
  • bone mineral density loss; associated with orally-inhaled corticosteroid use, especially with prolonged immobilization, family history of osteoporosis, and chronic use of drugs that reduce bone mass (eg, anticonvulsants and oral corticosteroids); monitoring recommended (oral inhalation)
  • bronchospasm may occur following dosing for asthma; treat immediately with a fast-acting inhaled bronchodilator; discontinuation and switch to an alternative therapy may be necessary (oral inhalation)
  • Candida albicans infection may occur; monitoring recommended; discontinuation of therapy may be required
  • cataracts, glaucoma, or increased intraocular pressure; new onset or worsening may occur; monitoring recommended
  • epistaxis, nasal ulceration, nasal septal perforation may occur; avoid direct contact with nasal septum; discontinuation of therapy may be required (nasal spray)
  • immunosuppression may result in more susceptibility to serious infections and communicable diseases; use caution or avoid use in patients with untreated systemic fungal, bacterial, viral, or parasitic infections, or ocular herpes simplex
  • nasal septum ulcers, nasal trauma, or recent nasal surgery; use not recommended until healed (nasal spray)
  • pediatric patients; may reduce growth velocity; routine monitoring recommended
  • tuberculosis, active or quiescent; use caution or avoid use
  • unvaccinated or patients without a history of chickenpox or measles; increased risk of severe or even fatal course of illness; if exposed, immune globulin and/or antiviral therapy may be needed
  • to report suspected adverse reactions, contact the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Musculoskeletal:Arthralgia (oral inhalation, 0.9% to 3.5%), Backache (oral inhalation, 0.6% to 3.1%)
  • Neurologic:Headache (intranasal, up to 3.1%; oral inhalation, 4.9% to 11%)
  • Otic:Otalgia (intranasal, 2.2%)
  • Respiratory:Epistaxis (intranasal, 2.9% to 11.4%), Nasal congestion (oral inhalation, 1.8% to 5.5%), Nasopharyngitis (intranasal, 3.7%; oral inhalation, 7% to 10.5%), Pain in throat (oral inhalation, 2.4% to 4.7%), Sinusitis (oral inhalation, 3.1% to 5.5%), Upper respiratory infection (intranasal, at least 2%; oral inhalation, 4.1% to 8.7%)
  • Other:Pain, In extremity (oral inhalation, 0.3% to 3.1%)
Serious
  • Endocrine metabolic:Adrenal insufficiency
  • Immunologic:Hypersensitivity reaction (rare)
  • Ophthalmic:Cataract, Glaucoma, Raised intraocular pressure
  • Respiratory:Bronchospasm, Exacerbation of asthma (6%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: The precise mechanism of action of corticosteroids in asthma and allergic rhinitis is unknown. Corticosteroids have been shown to have a wide range of effects on multiple cell types (mast cells, eosinophils, basophils, lymphocytes, macrophages, and neutrophils) and mediators (eg, histamine, eicosanoids, leukotrienes, and cytokines) involved in allergic inflammation. Ciclesonide is a pro-drug that is enzymatically hydrolyzed to des-ciclesonide, the pharmacologically active metabolite.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Tmax, Oral inhalation: 1.04 hours
  • Bioavailability, Oral: less than 1%
  • Effect of food: not established

sub.title: Distribution
sub.mono:
• Protein binding: 99% or greater
  • Vd, ciclesonide (prodrug): 2.9 L/kg
  • Vd, des-ciclesonide (active metabolite): 12.1 L/kg

sub.title: Metabolism
sub.mono:
• Nasal mucosa: hydrolysis to active metabolite, des-ciclesonide, via esterases
  • Lung: hydrolysis to active metabolite, des-ciclesonide, via esterases
  • Liver: predominantly CYP3A4
  • Metabolite: des-ciclesonide: active

sub.title: Excretion
sub.mono:
• Renal clearance: 20% or less as des-ciclesonide (active metabolite)
  • Fecal: 66% as des-ciclesonide (active metabolite)
  • Total body clearance: 152 L/hr (ciclesonide); 228 L/hr (des-ciclesonide)

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• Inhalation, oral
    Alvesco(R) prime the inhaler by actuating 3 times before the first use or when the inhaler has not been used for more than 10 consecutive days; no need to shake inhaler before use
  • Nasal
    • (Omnaris(R)) shake and prime the pump by actuating 8 times before use
    • (Omnaris(R)) if not used for 4 consecutive days, gently shake and re-prime with one spray or until a fine mist appears
    • (Zetonna(TM)) prime the pump by actuating 3 times before initial use
    • (Zetonna(TM)) re-prime the pump with 3 actuations if not used for 10 consecutive days
    • (Zetonna(TM)) reassemble device and test with 1 test-spray if canister and actuator become separated

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• asthma: reduction in symptoms and improved pulmonary function tests, such as FEV1, are evidence of efficacy (oral inhalation)
  • seasonal or perennial allergic rhinitis: reduction in symptoms of are evidence of efficacy (nasal inhalation)
  • (oral inhalation) bone mineral density in patients with major risk factors for decreased bone mineral content.
  • cataracts and glaucoma; routinely, especially in patients with a change in vision and/or a history of cataracts, glaucoma, or increased intraocular pressure
  • linear growth velocity in pediatric patients; routinely
  • signs and symptoms of candida infections of mouth, pharynx and nose

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Alvesco
    Inhalation Aerosol Liquid: 80 MCG/Actuation, 160 MCG/Actuation
  • Omnaris
    Nasal Spray: 50 MCG/Actuation
  • Zetonna
    Nasal Aerosol Liquid: 37 MCG/Actuation

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patient that the inhalation aerosol is not indicated for acute asthma attacks or status asthmaticus.
  • Instruct patient to avoid exposure to chickenpox and measles. If exposure occurs, notify healthcare professional immediately.
  • Drug may cause headache, nasal discomfort, or nose bleed.
  • The oral inhalation aerosol may also cause nasopharyngitis, sinusitis, pharyngolaryngeal pain, upper respiratory infection, nasal congestion, or arthralgia.
  • Advise patient to immediately report changes in vision.
  • Advise patient using oral inhalation that symptomatic improvement may not be seen for 4 weeks or longer.
  • Instruct patient to report signs/symptoms of hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis suppression (fatigue, depression, anxiety, hyperglycemia, muscle weakness, immunosuppression symptoms). Patients on long-term therapy may be at increased risk for these effects.
  • Patient should also report signs/symptoms of infection, including fungal infection of the mouth and pharynx.
  • Caregivers of pediatric patients should monitor for and report decreased growth rate.
  • Instruct patients using the oral inhaler to use it exactly as directed and to rinse mouth with water after each use to prevent oral infections.
  • Advise patient against sudden discontinuation of drug.
  • Instruct patient on proper administration technique. Avoid direct contact with nasal septum or eyes.
